page.title: 04Cramlington:Development
page.content:
Before 1963, Cramlington consisted of the old village and a few colliery rows left over from the mining days at Nelson Village and Hartford. Then it became a new Town and has continued to grow ever since. There are many new housing estates, both council and private. The private housing ranges from inexpensive link villas to luxury detached houses. The street names in any estate always have the same initial letter. This makes it easier to find places. There are footpaths and cycle tracks between the estates, but there are no through roads for cars, so that it is safer for children. There is a new estate of houses being built very close to Burnside First School at the moment.
Burnside F.S.
